result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Richard Steven Bates in court. JSC in court. Court reviews case. Atty Bjork states there is not a resolution at this time and requests to set JT. AMENDED
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Victim 1 or their residence, as identified in the Identification Key.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

WHILE IN CUSTODY  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Victim 1.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device and cannot go within 500 feet of Victim 1's residence, as identified in the Identification Key. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:45 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  Defendant Richard Steven Bates in court, in custody.  Attorney John P Bjork in court for Richard Steven Bates.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Listening device has been provided to the DE.  Information has been filed.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Speedy trial demanded.  Atty Bjork states the victim is in court today. Requesting bond modification.  Response by the State.  Objection to lifting the no contact provision.  No objection to bond being reduced to $15k.  Argument by Atty Bjork.  Victim makes statement as to bond modification.  Court reduces bond amount to 10k.  Court will modify bond to no abusive contact while DE is still in custody. If cash is posted to no contact provision is put back in place.  Attys to schedule with JA.  Adjourned: 11:03

on Motion to seal or Redact a Court Record. sf  Per EFV- Seal Doc #3, Atty's are to only have access. bph

4:04 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Richard Steven Bates.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard Steven Bates in court, in custody. Atty Bates waives prelim. 

Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 4:10 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
